Class Trainer

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--Trainer
public class Trainer
extends java.lang.Object

The trainer class is used to represent the user in the world of pokemon. They know how much cash they have, their name, their number of their various item types, their message, their pokemon, and their number of pokemon.

Field Summary
 BattlePanel1 bp
          Used to communicate with the BattlePanel1.
 java.lang.String message
          Used for creating a message that an enemy trainer will say before commencing in battle.

Constructor Detail

Trainer

public Trainer(BattlePanel1 a)
Constructs a trainer that is in contact with the BattlePanel1 and prompts the user for a name and begins selecting a starting pokemon.

Trainer

public Trainer(BattlePanel1 ab,
               java.lang.String name,
               Pokemon a,
               Pokemon b,
               Pokemon c)
Instantiates a trainer that has 3 starting pokemon and is in contact with the BattlePanel1.

Parameters:
ab - Assigns ab to bp.
name - Assigns name to myName.
a - Assigns a to myPokemon[0].
b - Assigns b to myPokemon[1].
c - Assigns c to myPokemon[2].
Method Detail

chooseStartingPokemon

public void chooseStartingPokemon()
Prompts the user which pokemon they would like to start off with.

choosePokemon

public void choosePokemon(Charmander x)
Provides the user with a confirmation page, and a short blurb about charmander (the pokemon they have chosen in this case.)

Parameters:
x - If they confirm their choice, x will be assigned to myPokemon[0].

                       Pokemon p)

Parameters:
k - The spot in the array to place the pokemon.
p - The pokemon to place into the specified slot.
